A gem among the many existing Valve gems. 
Portal asks the question "What if you were stuck in the post-apocalypse as the test monkey of an insane AI?" and supplies plenty of hilarious answers.

The gameplay and mechanics are simple and explained well. Use a "Portal Gun" to create.. (SURPRISE!) portals, to help navigate through puzzles and complete various levels. The very few characters within this game are compelling and memorable as can be. Despite not having much more to say about the game, I can practically promise you a great experience, especially if you generally enjoy puzzle games.

9/10- It's hard not to love this game. I didn't expect much from it when I first played it years ago, but it turned out to be a game I'll always love.

A great puzzle solving game which also requires decent mechanics to get through. Overall, great game. 
Of course it is rather dated by now, so graphics are... suitable for its time.
Especially on discount, a must buy IMO.

This game never got old.

Minimalistic stage design and beautiful ambient tunes, also funny voice line, every element are perfect.

Game playing is not only solving a puzzle but also platforming so you need a little action skill at least. 

The only downside is a  pretty short playthrough is almost 3 hours, even additional contents appear after finished though. However, the recent price is about $1-2 is 100% worth it.

Since Portal has been universally hailed as one of the greatest games of all time, I'm just going to focus on the stuff someone in 2020 might appreciate. Yes it's a great game, everything you've read or heard about it is true, but it's waay too short, I got it in on sale at a super low price but i'd be really annoyed if I had payed full price for a game so short. Another thing: f*ck the platform parts,  room 18 is specially annoying since failing the super precise jumps will result in instant death, just like in a super mario game, it's specially annoying since you have to repeat either way, but dying is specially frustrating because you have to  go through the load screen, AND the character doesn't die instantly (why?!). By the way, the game is installed in an sdd and I'm still get loading screens, so yeah... really old game. So in short, if platforming doesn't make you want to break the screen or controls and you see this on sale, by all means it's still something you want to experience.
